snippet: More than 200 officers and intelligence agents raided an office and 12 homes in the northern city-state of Bremen to enforce a ban on a Salafist group.
abstract: German police and intelligence agents raid office and homes in Bremen, Germany, to enforce ban on Islamic Support Association, Salafist group suspected of ties to Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: More than 200 officers and intelligence agents raided an office and 12 homes in the northern city-state of Bremen to enforce a ban on a Salafist group.

headline.main: German Police Raid Property of Group Linked to ISIS
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Germany: Raids Target Banned Group

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
